official-title.#text: To amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act to allow the marketing, distribution, or sale of solid antimicrobial copper alloys with certain claims, to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to exclude certain solid antimicrobial copper alloys from regulation as drugs or devices, and for other purposes.

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 3 of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act/s:3

header.#text: Treatment of solid antimicrobial copper alloys under Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act
Claims made for solid antimicrobial copper alloys

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, solid antimicrobial copper alloys, and products made from such alloys, may be marketed, distributed, or sold with labeling making claims regarding the microbial reduction or infection control efficacy of the alloys if the claims are consistent with the results of—
federally-funded clinical trials finding greater than 25 percent reductions in infection rate or 50 percent reductions in microbial burden; or
federally-funded clinical trials finding statistically significant reductions in infection rate or microbial burden.

The registration of solid antimicrobial copper alloys under this section shall not require submission or review of efficacy data related to claims consistent with the results of the clinical trials described in paragraph (1).

header.#text: Submission or review of efficacy data waived

text.#text: Claims described in paragraph (1) shall be consistent with the product label registered under this section.

The registrant shall submit a notification identifying the proposed claims that are consistent with the results of the clinical trials described in paragraph (1), and include a copy of the proposed amended product label.
Within 30 days after receipt of such a notification, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: objects to any of the proposed claims as not consistent with the results of the clinical trials described in paragraph (1); and

text.#text: notify the registrant in writing if the
state the reasons why.
A registrant may file a response to any such objection not later than 30 days after the registrant’s receipt of the objection.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall issue a decision within 30 days.

A decision under clause (iv) shall be considered to be a final agency action.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: issues an objection as described in this subparagraph.

text.#text: A registrant may distribute or sell a solid antimicrobial copper alloy product with the claims described in paragraph (1) after 60 days of submission of the notification described in this subparagraph, unless the

In lieu of the notification process under subsection (c)(9), registration of a solid antimicrobial copper alloy may be modified to ensure the consistency of claims described in paragraph (1) with the product labeling pursuant to the following process:

header.#text: Consistency of claims with agency-registered product label

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subchapter E of chapter V of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/ch:V/sch:E
Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:569C

header.#text: Treatment of solid antimicrobial copper alloys under Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act

text.#text: A product that is made from solid antimicrobial copper alloy and has labeling making a claim regarding the microbial reduction or infection control efficacy of the alloy, consistent with the results of federally-funded clinical trials, shall not, by virtue of such claim—

header.#text: Exclusion from treatment as drug or device

text.#text: be treated as a drug or device, or as a combination thereof, for purposes of this Act; or
otherwise be subject to regulation by the
